paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Patients from endemic foci in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients from conventional endemic foci in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden have the Val30Met mutation.
Many patients with later disease onset are found in Sweden despite having the same mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation leads to a less stable TTR protein, resulting in amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on familial segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most common among ATTRv amyloidosis patients.
key_quotes: ATTRVal30Met amyloidosis patients from endemic foci in Japan and Portugal are characterized by an early age of disease onset.
Patients from nonendemic areas are characterized by late onset of the disease, usually after 50 years of age.

patients.demographics: African American patients from West African countries

individual_records.phenotype_details: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val122Ile mutation is considered a common cause of heart disease in African Americans.
A number of Caucasian patients with the Val122Ile mutation have also been found in Italy.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation leads to destabilization of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in African American populations.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and familial segregation.
variants.additional_notes: Currently, this mutation is considered to be the most common among ATTRv amyloidosis patients worldwide.
key_quotes: Currently, this mutation, rather than Val30Met mutation, is considered to be the most common among ATTRv amyloidosis patients worldwide.

tables_processed.table_caption: Representative red flags for ATTR amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
